intro: Saussurea namhaedoana, commonly known as the Namhaedoan橐吾, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South Korea. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine habitats, showcasing adaptations to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are basal, lobed, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with purple or brown centers. Saussurea namhaedoana is valued for its potential traditional medicinal uses and ecological significance in its native ecosystem.
